objects.name: Analytic 0770
objects.description: Detection of rogue Domain Controller registration and Active Directory replication abuse by correlating: (1) creation/modification of nTDSDSA and server objects in the Configuration partition, (2) unexpected usage of Directory Replication Service SPNs (GC/ or E3514235-4B06-11D1-AB04-00C04FC2DCD2), (3) replication RPC calls (DrsAddEntry, DrsReplicaAdd, GetNCChanges) originating from non-DC hosts, and (4) Kerberos authentication by non-DC machines using DRS-related SPNs. These events in combination, especially from hosts outside the Domain Controllers OU, may indicate DCShadow or rogue DC activity.

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: m365:dirsync
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Replication cookie changes involving Configuration partition with new server/nTDSDSA objects.

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: NSM:Flow
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: DrsAddEntry, DrsReplicaAdd, GetNCChanges calls between non-DC and DCs.

x_mitre_mutable_elements.description: Window (seconds) between nTDSDSA object creation and subsequent replication traffic from same host (default 300s).
List of legitimate DCs authorized for replication to reduce false positives.
SPNs indicating replication service usage (GC/, GUID E3514235-4B06-11D1-AB04-00C04FC2DCD2).
Trigger alerts only when AD object creation is by accounts not in Domain Admins or Enterprise Admins groups.
